main event: Two bright lights were observed in the sky over the North Atlantic Ocean on 6 November 1957.
interesting points: The lights were described as very prominent and were moving across the sky from east to west., The sighting lasted for 3 minutes., The observation was made at 2300 EST., The source of the sighting was civilian., The conclusion made by the observer was that the lights appeared to be the Aurora borealis.
sighted object: two bright lights in the sky
